title: key of all zeroes
extract: In cryptography, a weak key is a key, which, used with a specific cipher, makes the cipher behave in some undesirable way. ... Nevertheless, it is considered desirable for a cipher to have no weak keys. A cipher with no weak keys is said to have a flat, or linear, key space.
extract_html: In cryptography, a weak key is a key, which, used with a specific cipher, makes the cipher behave in some undesirable way. ... Nevertheless, it is considered desirable for a cipher to have no weak keys. A cipher with no weak keys is said to have a flat, or linear, key space.
